message:
Emad Elsaid's bot/script along with a number of other scripts I'm using now are getting me to wonder about this question:
What platforms/tools are available to store and quickly execute those small scripts? Either on-demand or automatically (scheduled or on-event)?
One example is GitHub't Hubot, but it's limited in that it needs a chat room and the scripts I've seen are written in CoffeeScript.
Any other similar platforms?

data.message: The idea is to have something like Iron Man's Jarvis, but without the speech recognition :)
In Linux you look for a cron jobs hosting. In Windows you look for a VPS and use Quartz.NET, or use an Azure worker roles / web jobs / scheduler depending on the job.

If you go VPS in Linux, this may be useful as well:
https://github.com/jamesrwhite/minicron
(although you can get hosting just for the cron jobs you want, and not worry about managing the server)
Showed up on my radar today
That's cool, but I think it's mostly for scheduled jobs. What about on-demand tasks?
Most often it's either a web resource you can call, or a scheduled job that polls / checks for new requests (every few minutes for example)
i think Amr is talking about some kind of "tasks brain", attached to set of events/signals, set of actions/tasks similar to Hubot
Yeah, that's I meant like Emad Elsaid explained. I'm approach this as a user (maybe advanced user) rather than a developer.
